title: Nice place to see
review_text: We had been there just after snowfall in Darjeeling and really the place brings peace in mind. The Scenic beauty is also heart touching.

title: Good place to visit
review_text:
Its a part of local sightseeing. A good place with good view. Photogenic location. 

The temple is nice. 
Must visit

title: Nice Pagoda; Terrible approach road
review_text:
Its a very nice and serene place once you reach the top and get inside the compound. You can spend some time enjoying the pagoda and the shrine. Also, some nice views from the top. Worth a visit if you have time on your hand. 

As in most places in Darjeeling, you are better off walking (although roads are quite narrow). If you take your car up there , be careful where and how your driver parks because you can get stuck quite badly.

title: Serene location
review_text: Its situated on a hilltop at a very calm and serene location. You will feel at peace at this location !

title: Peaceful place
review_text: First we went inside the Japanese temple and it was such a pleasure to able to do prayers alongside temple people.Its a beautiful and peaceful place. Then we visited the adjacent peace Pagoda. Beautiful budha statue located on hill top. Have to climb stairs. Wonderful place from where you can have bird's eye view of the town & also get some candid clicks. One of the best attractions of the town. Must visit if in Darjeeling

title: Wonderful. Must see with family.
review_text: First best part is cleanliness. Second best part is hygeine. Third best part is you don't have to pay a single rupee to enter. It gives you peace as the name says and you will surely enjoy with your family while taking nice photos and videos. Very nice place. Must visit with your frnd or family members if you come to Darjeeling.

title: Awsome place.
review_text: We walk to the Peace Pagoda, giving us a good work-out! Joined A drumming session which we enjoyed before visiting the Pagoda itself. Now we want to visit them all!

title: A very nice peaceful place with beautiful suuroundings
review_text: Located at the end of Gandhi road, a very nice temple and Pagoda. Very quiet, serene. Beautiful statues of Lord Buddha

title: Tranquility
review_text: After the busy sight seeing schedules, end with this visit. You will become calm, tranquilized and enjoy the meditation. Have a silent and slow walk later which will be in your memories for ages.

title: Excellent example of a pagoda in Darjeeling
review_text: Beautiful pagoda/temple in Darjeeling. Well kept, clean, and peaceful. The views of the mountains from this place are amazing and the shrine itself provides a sense of peace and calmness.

title: Peace and Calm
review_text: Go for stunning views, tall pine trees and spend some time close to nature, away from hustle and bustle of Darjeeling.

title: Na Mu Myo Ho Ren Ge Kyo
review_text:
It was indeed very peaceful to be there and sitting inside the temple while playing drums and chanting ‘Na Mu Myo Ho Ren Ge Kyo’ was a different experience. 

The place was full of positive energy.

title: Serene place
review_text: Beautiful place next to the Japanese temple. It's little bit on the higher altitude so gets little colder. The Pagoda is a beautiful white structure with various statues of Buddha. Nice place to sit around and admire the natural beauty.

title: Japanese Temple with Peace
review_text: It is a wonderful place and there was a chanting mantra with a Rhythm were we can play as per their tunes and it was a mind soothing experience.

title: Nice and peaceful
review_text:
A small temple but a nice one. Very elegantly built. Don't miss the prayer hall on the first floor and be a part of the prayer if its on. Very soothing when you sing along with the folks there. 

Parking space is less though.

title: In the scenic view
review_text: A white monumental structure of Japanese Buddhist faith overlooking a majestic landscape is delight for every tourist.

title: A must see destination
review_text: The walk from Sarover hotel to the Temple is a nice and serene one. A temple like this right on one of the highest points in Darjeeling gives both peace of mind and a view to die for...a must visit.

title: Serene
review_text: It's a beautiful japanese pagoda set in jalapahar , Darjeeling. It has 4 Avatars of Buddha. It was build by japanese monk.

title: Excellent!

title: Very Good

title: Peaceful place
review_text: When you visit this place you will see two sights one is the Japanese temple and other is the peace pagoda. When the whether is clear you will be able to see Kanchanjaunga peak and other mountains. It gives beautiful view of Darjeeling from the top.

title: Visit to Peace Pagoda, Darjeeling
review_text:
It is located in the hilly town of Darjeeling, West Bengal, india. it is designed to unite people of all races and creeds for the world peace. The view of Kanchenjunga is beautiful from this place in a clear day. It was inaugurated on 1st November 1992. the height of the pagoda is 94 ft and diameter is 75 ft. The place is surrounded by long Pine trees. 
Courtesy: Wikipedia.

title: Most beautiful thing to admire in Darjeeling
review_text: Really it’s the number one place to visit. Stand in front of Buddha and tell yourself that peace in the world is possible. Very powerful place

title: Serene place.
review_text: It is nice place, we got to see the japanese style prayer, and even sat and played their instrument with them

title: Mrs
review_text: Good, clean, beautiful structure like every Buddhist temple. Yes nice to visit. But it took less than half and hour, if you like it then visit.

title: Serenity
review_text: I started my walk to this place on an early afternoon. It was about a 4km walk, and the road was calm and weather, perfect. The place is a must visit for anyone travelling to Darling. The place had not more than 10 people, and was very quiet and beautiful. I’d not only recommend the place, but also recommend that you walk to it.

title: Must visit.
review_text: A must visit place if you are in Darjeeling, though in case of traffic jams one might have to walk a considerable distance uphill which can be challenging for some ..but once you are there it’s totally worth it. A peaceful place offering breathtaking views.

title: Very peaceful

title: Japanese White Peace Pagoda
review_text:
Japanese Buddhist temple and Stupa located in a beautiful picturesque place that is especially clearly seen in sunny days. The pagoda (stupa) is one of the many similar pagodas of the world, the construction of which was the idea of a 20th century Japanese ascetic Nichidatsu Fujii. 
. If you come here in the early morning, you can fully enjoy the peace and beautiful views of the garden. 
We fell in love with this place!

title: Beautiful place
review_text: Peaceful and amazing experience must go once for sure. I’ll visit this place again purely cause it’s peaceful and amazing view from a Photography standpoint. Kanchenjunga view is amazing from here.

title: True to it’s name
review_text:
The Japanese Peace Pagoda is really peaceful and the view of the Kanchenjunga mountain from there is absolutely spectacular. 
It’s a must visit.

title: Japanese Peace Pagoda
review_text: Nice place to visit, peaceful, the view around is majestic. One can clearly see the Kanchenjunga mountain (the 3rd highest peak in the world).

title: Japanese temple visit

title: Peaceful and relaxed

review_text: I found this place with a spontaneous walk with a stranger. A peaceful and powerful experience, especially with the prayer drumming. The rhythm of the heart <3

title: Nice place
review_text: We quite liked this pagoda. It's worth the trek from the mall and, in a town where everything seems to be uphill, the walk to it was mercifully flat. Quite pleasant.

title: Very calm and nice buddhist temple
review_text: The place is very nicely maintained. Unlikely ghoom monestary , it is really neat and clean. You can get a very nice feeling of calmness here. In addition , the city view is very beautiful from this place. plan to spend 30 ~ 45 minutes .

title: Go for the drumming and the views
review_text:
Visiting the pagoda and the temple was one of the main highlights of my trip to Darjeeling. 

The pagoda is beautiful and there is a great view of the mountains from the top. 

I went late in the afternoon (5pm) and it was quiet. Only about 10 visitors. 

The temple is also definitely something to see. Everyone at the temple was so friendly and welcoming. We were invited to join in the drumming and chanting which was a brilliant experience and very calming. We also learnt a bit more about Nipponzan Myohoji buddhism. 

The drumming happens every morning and every evening so lots of opportunity to go along during your stay. More

title: Beautiful
review_text: Very picturesque location. Lots of steps so not suitable for senior citizens. There is also a Japanese Buddhist temple in the same location

title: Peaceful place
review_text:
If you want time for yourself and have peaceful environment you must visit this place. But avoid critical crowd timing to njoy this environment. 
I visited this place early morning so very few people was there.

title: Always worth a trip to the Peace Pagoda
review_text: We have visited several of the Japanese Peace Pagodas and always find them to be tranquil. This one has lovely reliefs around the stupa. We also sat for a while inside the temple and you are encouraged to join in with the chanting.

title: Head here for some peace and tranquil
review_text: Head to this peace pagoda, built by the Japanese, to get some peace and tranquility. Apart from the pagoda, there is a temple where prayers and chanting happens, which you can join in and is highly recommended. If you love to walk/trek, would suggest to walk down from here to the Gandhi road, and you would love it.

title: a taste of history
review_text: The imposing pagoda is located in a forest area - getting rarer now in Darjeeling - and is therefore a peaceful spot to meditate (if only the tourists would stop making phone calls!). The tiny monastery just below has some interesting photographs and a history of how this came to be built. Gandhians - see the Wardha connection! But a request to all visitors; please don't disturb the resident monks, this is their home and place of worship, not your picnic point.

title: Peaceful
review_text: Built by the Japanese. The best time to visit is during the sunset. Stunning views. But be aware that this place tends to get overcrowded at evenings during season time.

title: Beautiful buddha pagoda
review_text: Very good pagoda infrastructure.. big golden buddha statues... buddha life moments are carved on wooden wall... good Buddhist temple...

title: Adjacent to a Japanese shrine
review_text: The Peace Pagoda is not a "must see" attraction, but do stop and see it if it is on your way during sight seeing.

title: Must visit
review_text: This is a must visit attraction in Darjeeling. Atop a mountain, the view from the pagoda is simply beautiful. Also the statues of 4 forms of Buddha that have been placed on the Pagoda are amazing. Need to climb quite a bit to get here but it is worth the walk.

title: Very beautiful temple and Buddha history carvings
review_text: We went there in morning and it’s a very beautiful Buddhist temple of Japanese origin. Very peaceful . The peace pagoda which is seperate has 4 Buddha statues at various stage of his life and life history carvings . Very informative for adults and teens

title: Serene and peaceful temple
review_text: Must see on your Darjeeling trip. The Japanese Pagoda was peaceful with greenery surrounding it. The Buddha statues was just magnificent.

title: Attraction in Darjeeling
review_text: This is one of the main attractions in Darjeeling town. Earlier when we visited the place 5 years back, people had to walk a lot to reach the temple, but now cars go up to near the Japanese temple and you don't have to walk much. The place is calm and silent.

title: Serene and peaceful
review_text: The Japanese temple is very peaceful and you can offer your prayers along with a monk chanting and beating a drum. A beautiful experience in itself. The peace pagoda is dedicated to Buddha and has intricate carvings and offers picturesque views all around. Will not take a very long time here so definitely worth a visit.

title: Beautiful!
review_text: This temple is beautiful and well worth the visit. It is smaller than expected (not in a bad way) so you don't need to set aside heaps of time to check it out.

title: very nice place

review_text: I had a lovely leisurely afternoon hike up the hill to the Japanese peace pagoda and temple. I stayed for the start of the afternoon prayer session also. Lovely views of Darjeeling and the pagoda itself is beautiful also.

review_text:
The Peace Pagoda was initiated by Fuji Guruji. 
The appearance of the Peace Pagoda is considered an embodiment of Buddha which radiates the importance of nonviolence. 
It stands as the core of spirituality and peace. 
There are 4 Buddha statues polished in gold & 8 panels relief carved in sand stone.

title: Tranquility
review_text: In the midst of serene environment an apt place for the Temple of peace and tranquility. A must visit place of Darjeeling. Abode of peace.

title: Where Chants & Silence Play together
review_text: Well kept, peaceful and too silent. Silence that is broken by humming sound of chants. You can visit the Peace Pagoda, get imersed in the simplicity of the structure and life and you can also be a part of the prayers. It's peace that people pray for. Religion no bar. Over all a place that provides solace to soul. Yes, don't blame me if after visiting Peace Pagoda, you feel taking the path of Siddharth. Yes, it's peaceful and tempting at the same time.

The peace pagoda in white colour is a beautiful sight !!

title: Peace
review_text: That is very touching as it's dedicated to the horror of Hiroshima and Nagasaki nuclear bomb attack. So I'm Russian Orthodox Christian but this place is not about Buddhism only it's about our solidarity in the face of our survival. Generally the place is peaceful and beautiful!

title: Peaceful place

title: Must Visit
review_text: Peaceful Buddha temple attached with a prayer hall. In Prayer hall , visitors are asked to sit and recite the mantra (being taught by them).

title: Peaceful place
review_text: Japanese Peace Pagoda and Buddhist Temple are located in a secluded part of Darjeeling town. The road leading to it winds through a small forest that surrounds the temple complex. The forest makes the whole area quite peaceful and if you visit early morning it feels very calm and serene. The temple is Japanese - very simple and bare ("to the point"). The pagoda is nearby and it's big but very well-maintained - looks beautiful and grand. You have to climb a few steps to reach the dome itself and then you can walk around the base of the dome looking at the reliefs and frescos with scenes from Buddha's life. The garden around the pagoda is also well-maintained and beautiful. More

title: Symbol of Peace
review_text:
It is a sacred symbol of peace and non voilence. It is an inspiration to establish unity, harmony and good will among the people of the entire world. The stupa is said to purify the land and soul of people.Climb up the steps and take walk around 'parikrama'.Watch the beautiful carvings of avtars of Budha in sitting,sleeping,meditating and standing postures.There is also artwork depicting life of Budha and his relics around the stupa.you have beautiful views of mountain range from the top. 
visit the budhist teple in the complex.We were in time for the prayer.We participated in the chanting beating the drumpad with the sticks.

title: Quiet and Beautiful

title: A beautiful place
review_text:

On Pagoda, there is a big Buddha statue. There one can see important events of Buddha life pictured on Pagoda. We can see a beautiful view of Darjeeling from this place. You can sit here and enjoy the peacefulness. 

Really worth a visit.
